perturbation.original_text: Power2Ship must provide WLI with a weekly report listing the serial number of every Unit shipped to a customer during the prior week.
perturbation.changed_text: Power2Ship will endeavor to provide WLI with a periodic report listing the serial number of Units shipped to a customer.
perturbation.explanation: By changing 'must provide' to 'will endeavor to provide,' the obligation becomes discretionary. The replacement of 'weekly' with 'periodic' and removing 'every' introduces ambiguity regarding the frequency and completeness of the reports. This contradicts the need for precise and timely records as mandated by standard business practices and potentially tax regulations.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General business compliance regulations and potentially tax regulations.

perturbation.original_text: Power2Ship must provide WLI with a complete copy of its monthly airtime bill for the Units as received by the respective wireless operators (T-Mobile, Verizon, AT&T, etc.). Power2Ship is required to keep all the WLI Unit activations on every wireless network on a separate account from any other vendor's brand used by Power2Ship. Every such monthly invoice (one per operator) must be submitted to WLI within 7 days from the date it is received by Power2Ship and the invoice must include all pages listed on the invoice (example 7of 7 pages). Power2Ship's Chief Executive Officer or Chief Financial Officer
perturbation.changed_text: Power2Ship should attempt to provide WLI with a copy of its airtime bill for the Units. Power2Ship may keep WLI Unit activations on a separate account. The invoice should generally be submitted within a reasonable timeframe. Power2Ship’s officers will attempt to confirm the account numbers.
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'must provide' to 'should attempt to provide' makes providing the airtime bill optional, and replacing 'is required to' with 'may' makes keeping the activations on a separate account discretionary. Replacing 'must be submitted within 7 days' with 'should generally be submitted within a reasonable timeframe' makes the submission deadline vague. This contradicts standard accounting practices and the need for accurate billing, making audits challenging and creating financial discrepancies. Similarly, changing ‘must confirm’ to ‘will attempt to confirm’ weakens the obligation of officers.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (GAAP) and standard auditing practices.

perturbation.original_text: WLI shall use its reasonable efforts to deliver Products to Power2Ship on the date of delivery specified by Power2Ship. WLI will use its reasonable efforts to notify Power2Ship of any delays in scheduled delivery dates.
perturbation.changed_text: WLI may attempt to deliver Products to Power2Ship around the specified delivery date. WLI might notify Power2Ship of potential delays.
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'shall use its reasonable efforts' to 'may attempt to' weakens the obligation to deliver on time. Replacing 'will use its reasonable efforts to notify' with 'might notify' makes the notification of delays discretionary. This introduces uncertainty about WLI's commitment to timely delivery and communication, potentially violating basic contract law principles regarding delivery obligations. Also, changing the sentence to include `around` creates an ambiguity in the agreement regarding the date that delivery can happen.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Basic contract law principles regarding delivery obligations and UCC guidelines for reasonable commercial expectations.
